{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3608460,"name":"Mateo","username":"Notwo20","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/ad7895/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-04-30T22:15:06.510Z","cooked":"

First Season in FTC - Looking for Help from the Community!

Hi FIRST community!

We’re FTC Team 26333 Low Altitude from Latin America, and we wanted to share a bit about our rookie season — and ask for your advice to help us improve!

This past season was our first year competing as an FTC team. We built a robot featuring:

  • A mecanum drive base (yes, it drifts )
  • A telescoping arm as our main game mechanism

While we were proud of what we accomplished as rookies, we also faced some big challenges. The biggest issue? Our telescoping arm couldn’t retract properly after extending, which really limited us during matches.

Now that off-season is approaching, we want to learn from our mistakes and level up. Have any teams worked with similar telescoping arms? What tips, mechanisms, or best practices do you recommend to make retraction more reliable?

We’ve included some photos of our robot below so you can see what we built

A look at our current robot

Here’s the mecanum chassis and telescoping arm from last season — ready for upgrades and improvements!

115750×750 85.3 KB

114750×750 81.6 KB

113750×750 87.1 KB

11750×750 70.3 KB

One of 254’s teams (23222) built a very similar robot architecture. I am curious how you did your extension and retraction / rope rigging. Continuous vs cascade, what diameter/material rope, what’s the drum look like.

Do you have CAD for this robot you would consider releasing? I could connect you with the 254 students.

Hi dude ajajja i think nowadays none say it anymore…
We’ll be so grateful if you have the opportunity to connect us to them that would be amazing!
As i mention this was our first year as FTC team so we have a lot of things to improve.

We went with a cascade-style extension. Unfortunately, i
don’t have CAD files available right now, but I do have a quick diagram showing how the rigging works:

brazito ftc1428×542 36.8 KB

  • It doesn’t retract by gravity
  • Instead, we actively retract it by reversing the direction of the motor pulling the string

Thanks again for offering to help. We’re excited to learn more and keep leveling up

I have found these diagrams and write ups very useful for my understanding. These are from 4476 W.A.F.F.L.E.S Robotics in Ontario

wiki.wafflesrobotics.com

Elevator

What is an Elevator? An elevator is a linear extension mechanism generally used to move game pieces and/or robot mechanisms vertically. They are usually built from 2” x 1” extrusion and small bearings.
